It was SO great to hear live music last night. Broken Social Scene totally rocked. At one point there were 11 band members on stage. They are so Toronto-looking and cute and everything. There's a lot to be said for this sort-of instrumental rock they play, it's sort of pop-y but without the chorus/verse structure and it's sort of wall-of-sound but is also very catchy. And the horns were awesome. One of the band kept saying, 'it's not Buffalo, it's Beautiful!' which rather sums up Buffalo. Ironically. It was a hilarious crowd: think maybe 100-200 people that knew of the band and then another 500+ that milled around drinking $2.50 Labatts wearing tube tops and backwards baseball caps. Plus a smattering of homeless-types who grooved to the music, some families, etc. A real mix, which is nice, since most crowds tend to look the same when you see a particular band. We had a good laugh at this couple of guys in the front row that kept making this rockin' move where they'd shake their index finger in time to the music: think "power-fist rock-on" combined with "sign of the devil" only with just the index finger pointing. And the back of the hand towards the band, and the finger sort-of crooked. Other people were noticing too, it was that funny. It was really loud, and I was a bit anxious about whether it would hurt the babe, but googled it when we got home and there doesn't seem to be any prob. So it was a great first concert for this babe, who will definitely come out loving music, if we have anything to say about it!

urlLink Why Nerds are Unpopular Wow, a really cogent essay on teenage unpopularity, that doesn't posit that it's because all nerds are socially maladept! This guy blames the system & the suburbs for creating artificial prisons for teenagers, which lead to popularity contests that those with greater interest in being smart (nerds) can't win because it takes so much energy to be popular. Very thoughtful and well written.

I am finally, officially out of the pregnancy closet. Today I am 13 weeks pregnant and wearing maternity jeans for the first time! They're still a little big, but much more comfortable to have a pair of jeans that actually doesn't cut off the feeling below my waist. I'm ambivalent about showing--part of me wants to be big already, wants to feel the baby kick, and part of me likes still feeling more-or-less like regular me. Particularly now that the constant nausea is gone, and I'm not falling asleep (too often) with my head on my desk at work. Though I did enjoy a brief catnap today on my boss's couch. Shh...
